p: Scientific investigations try to validate the antidiabetic potential of several Middle East medicinal plants using several methods of extraction, plant organs, and solvents. The majority of the studies used aqueous maceration as an extraction method ( Figure 2 and Figure 3) Water was mostly used as a solvent as the researchers simulated the ethnobotanical use by people. Among plant parts, leaves were the most frequently used part (28%) ( Figure 4.)
